page.title: 09RELIGION GOLDSBOROUGH
page.content: The church of{ST.MARY}stands next to{Goldsborough Hall.}The oldest part of the{church}dates back to Norman times.The people of the Hall had their own entrance.Inside the church there are two fine{tombs}belonging to Richard de Goldsborough and his son. The church was finished in{1350.}The bells were hung before the tower was completed. The Rev Tony Betts is the{rector}of Knaresborough and Goldsborough.Some villagers would like him to belong to Goldsborough alone.He is the{chairman {of Governors}of the school. The {Mothers Union }was founded in 1903 and has 33 members.{Sunday School is held in {Goldsborough Hall.} The Rev Betts says that the church needs a new organ and bells.He would like a church hall! His congregation is a good size.There is room for more!
